# FuelTracker

Simple application demonstrating MVC architecture for tracking fuel usage.

## Installation

1. Ensure Python 3.12 is installed.
2. Install the required packages:

```bash
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

## Running

Launch the app directly with Python:

```bash
python -m src.app
```

A window titled *Fuel Tracker* will appear.

## Building an Executable

On Windows, run the provided batch script which uses PyInstaller:

```bat
build.bat
```

The resulting binary is placed in the `dist` folder. Set the `SIGNTOOL` and `CERT_PATH` environment variables to automatically sign the executable. The PyInstaller spec embeds the application icon as a base64 string so no separate icon file is required.

## Folder Structure

```
FuelTracker/
├── assets/          # Images and other static files
├── src/             # Application source code
│   ├── controllers/
│   ├── models/
│   ├── services/
│   └── views/
├── tests/           # Unit tests
├── build.bat        # Build script for Windows
├── build.spec       # PyInstaller spec
├── requirements.txt
└── README.md
```
